Class OddMagicSquare

  • java.lang.Object
    • OddMagicSquare

  • public class OddMagicSquare
extends java.lang.Object
    This class asks the user to provide a positive, odd integer to create a magic square, which is a 2-dimensional array to hold the integers. The class also makes use of isMagic method to examine if the magic square remains a magic square after flipped horizontally or vertically.
    Version:
    01/10/12
    Author:
    Chun-Wei Chen

    • Constructor Detail

      • OddMagicSquare

        public OddMagicSquare(int n)
        Construct an n x n magic square. A magic square of order N is an N x N arrangement of the integers from 1 to N * N into rows and columns such that the rows, columns, and the 2 diagonals add up to the same number, N (N * N + 1) / 2.
        Parameters:
        n - a positive odd integer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is not a positive odd integer

    • Method Detail

        Returns:
        the copy of the matrix of the magic square

      • isMagic

        public static boolean isMagic(int[][] m)
        Determine if the argument passed in is a magic square.
        Parameters:
        m - an integer 2-dimensional array
        Returns:
        true if the argument is a magic square
